body.p: If we randomly sample 36 Pell grant recipients and record the mean Pell grant award for the sample, then repeat the sampling process many, many times, what is the mean and standard deviation of the sample means?

part.hint: The mean of the distribution of sample means will be μ. The standard deviation will be σ/sqrt(n), where σ is the standard deviation of the population.
μ = 2,600, the average Pell grand for 2008. σ = 500, the standard deviation in Pell grants for 2008. n = 36, the sample size.
